clinical_study.brief_title: Risk Factors for Post-ESWL and Post-ERCP Pancreatitis
clinical_study.official_title: Risk Factors for Post-ESWL and Post-ERCP Pancreatitis in Patients With Chronic Pancreatitis

brief_summary.textblock: The study aimed to identify risk factors for post-ERCP pancreatitis(PEP) after ESWL, and the relationship between the occurrence of post-ESWL pancreatitis and PEP.

primary_outcome.description: The main outcome analyzed was the development of post-procedural pancreatitis, which was defined as clinical pancreatitis, meeting two of three the following criteria in accordance with the Revised Atlanta International consensus including pain consistent with AP; amylase or lipase more than 3 times the upper normal limit; characteristic findings on imaging.

primary_outcome.measure: post pancreatic extracorporeal shock wave lithotripsy (ESWL) pancreatitis
primary_outcome.description: The main outcome analyzed was the development of post-procedural pancreatitis, which was defined as clinical pancreatitis, meeting two of three the following criteria in accordance with the Revised Atlanta International consensus including pain consistent with AP; amylase or lipase more than 3 times the upper normal limit; characteristic findings on imaging.

study_pop.textblock: Consecutive CP patients treated with both ESWL and subsequent ERCP during the same hospitalization between October 2016 and July 2019 were included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnosed with chronic pancreatitis and treated with both ESWL and subsequent ERCP
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with isolated pancreatic tail stone
- Patients with suspected or established malignancy
- Patients with pancreatic ascites
- Patients attending other interventional clinical trials
- Patients with non-correctable coagulation disorder
- Patients with pregnancy
